meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: LEAD: Pope Inspires Devotion Priests and laymen in three cities visited by Pope John Paul II on his American tour say he succeeded in encouraging Roman Catholics to renew their faith. Page B9. Cuomo View of the Kremlin Governor Cuomo, back from a week in the Soviet Union, said the Russians might agree to discuss reducing human-rights abuses.

LEAD: Pope Inspires Devotion Priests and laymen in three cities visited by Pope John Paul II on his American tour say he succeeded in encouraging Roman Catholics to renew their faith. Page B9. Cuomo View of the Kremlin Governor Cuomo, back from a week in the Soviet Union, said the Russians might agree to discuss reducing human-rights abuses.

Pope Inspires Devotion Priests and laymen in three cities visited by Pope John Paul II on his American tour say he succeeded in encouraging Roman Catholics to renew their faith. Page B9. Cuomo View of the Kremlin Governor Cuomo, back from a week in the Soviet Union, said the Russians might agree to discuss reducing human-rights abuses. Page B8. U.S. and Canada in Talks Canadian and American cabinet officers meet today in Washington to explore the possibility of reviving talks on free trade. Page D1. Chinese Leader Hesitates Prime Minister Zhao Ziyang expressed reluctance to assume permanent leadership of China's Communist Party. Page A3. A Verdict in Tunis A Tunisian court ordered the death sentence for 7 of 90 Islamic militants, a milder decision than many Tunisians had expected. Page A10.
